chemoreception.notes: Larvae likely use chemoreception to locate hosts, as they inject digestive enzymes into the skin after crawling onto a host. This suggests the ability to detect host-related chemical cues.

mechanoreception.notes: Mites are able to crawl onto hosts, suggesting a sensitivity to touch, vibration, or other mechanical stimuli for navigation and host detection.

hygroreception.notes: They are often found in damp areas, suggesting they are able to detect humidity.
